title: shasan
author: shasan
content: What happened:: Providing 5* reviews for businessScammers Profile Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3517298Reference Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5421188Additional Notes: While they will provide 5* reviews for a business the business will be promoted wrongly. As a result, users of the site or those who might be interested in the reviews might be scammed/losers. If the site is a scam still they will receive a 5* review from this user. This should be avoided at any cost.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Due to these fake review providers, people don't have an idea about the right service so they get cheated easily. Even if a website has top level positive reviews nowadays, you should think twice before using any service from them. This kind of service is definitely illegal. And according to the policy of all other companies including Google, such fake reviews are also illegal. Such service providers are considered scammers and it is safe to stay away from them.

comments.author: coin-investor
comments.body: Part of their disclaimerQuoteDisclaimerPlease note that we do not endorse scammers or fraudsters. Our service is geared towards genuine business owners struggling with negative online reviews or not having enough reviews. Everybody makes mistakes. We give existing companies a second chance and help new businesses skyrocket their growth rate.Asking to provide fake reviews for their products already made their project a fraud, your business is doomed if you pay people to provide you with fake reviews, and those who offer this kind of service can even bribe those who hired them for their service because customers will never trust products and services that hire this kind of service, you are scamming people in a way that deceive them from the kind of service you are offering if I have a project I prefer one real good review than 10 fake good reviews.
